chargeHist.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Crampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 12/16/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  State filed an amended complaint.  COUNT 1:  CARRYING A CONCEALED WEAPON contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 941.23(2), 939.51(2)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended criminal complaint and waived reading.  Court reviewed the criminal complaint and found probable cause.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State did not file an amended complaint in this matter as previously discussed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial during charging week.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 17, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a final pretrial and a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court orders case adjourned for Status in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher J Crampton in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-043
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 24 for a Pretrial Conference.
